description: {"blocks":[{"key":"4j7fl","text":"Many xenobiotic metabolizing enzymes, such as P450s, SULTs, UGTs, and sulfatases, are expressed in the brain, including astrocytes, the most abundant cell type in the brain. To obtain a purified culture of primary astrocytes, a method was developed and confirmed through flow cytometry. Primary glial cells are isolated separately from male and female postnatal day 1/2 (PND1/2) rat pups to isolate developing astrocytes. Sex is first determined by the anogenital distance and then confirmed through PCR followed by gel electrophoresis. Once isolated, the medium is changed every 3-4 days with additional incubation at room temperature for 10 min on a plate shaker before aspirating media to release microglia. When flasks reach confluency, cells are passaged and reseeded with 2 x 105 cells per flask. Once the cells reached passage 3, or appear to be confluent with only astrocytes, flow cytometry is performed utilizing Anti-Iba1 and GFAP primary antibodies.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":784,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"660ec","text":"Prepare complete S-MEM","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":8,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2u0g6","text":"Add 5 mL pen/strep solution to the 500 mL S-MEM.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9m9vl","text":"Store complete S-MEM medium for up to 2 months at 4ºC ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1loo5","text":"Prepare dissociation medium and warm to 37ºC - MUST MAKE FRESH EACH ISOLATION DAY. Prepare 10 mL of dissociation medium per sex per litter of PND1/2 pups (20 mL total).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":8,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4ke0o","text":"Add 187.5 U dispase for cortex isolation per 125 mL complete S-MEM in an autoclaved container.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":36}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"99r27","text":"Sterilize with a 150 mL sterile filter flask (0.2 μm pore size, cellulose acetate)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7gma5","text":"Prewarm in 37ºC hot water bath for 1 hour before use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bfpmb","text":"Prepare astrocyte growth medium.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":8,"length":24}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3dkjg","text":"Add 900 mL MEM, 10 mL pen/strep, and 100 mL heat-inactivated horse serum to a 1 L sterile filter flask.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8ravt","text":"Sterilize with a 1 L sterile filter flask (0.2 μm pore size, cellulose acetate) by pulling vacuum through the apparatus.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"bns2v","text":"Store the astrocyte growth medium for up to 1 month at 4ºC.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a1ngp","text":"Prepare DNase I solution, 8000 U/mL.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":8,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7976p","text":"Add 15,000 U DNase I from bovine pancreas (type IV) to 1.875 mL autoclaved water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"go90","text":"Mix gently, do NOT vortex. DNase I from pancreas is vulnerable to inactivation by physical damage and should not be vortexed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"fan86","text":"Sterilize with a 0.2 μm syringe filter (cellulose acetate).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"25nov","text":"Store in 100 μL aliquots at -20ºC.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ao7ra","text":"Fire polish and Sigmacote treatment of pipets for cell isolation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"62bsi","text":"Fire polish the tip of a 9-in Pasteur pipet by placing the small end in an open flame from a Bunsen burner for a few seconds. This will slightly melt the glass and will produce a smooth tip to the pipet, which helps prevent damage to the cells. However, if the opening becomes too small, increased shear forces during titration may lead to increased cell damage.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":125}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"53d1","text":"Plug the large end of the fire-polished Pasteur pipets with cotton removed from a cotton-tipped swab or, alternatively, small pieces of cotton balls.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7gru1","text":"Treat fire-polished Pasteur pipets and 10 mL glass, cotton-plugged serological pipets with Sigmacote by drawing the viscous Sigmacote solution up into the pipet with a portable power pipettor. Do not let the solution touch the cotton plug. Allow Sigmacote to drain back into the bottle, and allow the pipets to drain and dry completely in a beaker lined with paper towels.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8dk69","text":"Place Sigmacoted pipets in a metal container with lid and autoclave.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7tdct","text":"Sex the pups based on anogenital distance (females will have a much shorter distance than males, compare pups to one another to be able to sex pups efficiently).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"17a98","text":"Autoclave fine-angled micro-dissecting scissors, large scissors, and forceps in a beaker wrapped with aluminum foil.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3drh6","text":"Place the head on a sterile gauze pad. Each head will be placed on a separate gauze pad.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9taki","text":"Remove brain from head.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"busd5","text":"Secure the head by holding down the snout.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"58psm","text":"With fine-angled micro-dissecting scissors, cut the skin along the midline from the base of the skull to the eyes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fnafe","text":"Use 0.8 mm forceps to separate skin and expose the skull as necessary.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7fc9o","text":"Cut skull along midline with micro-dissecting scissors.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bm3d8","text":"Cut away the skull flaps for easier removal of the brain, remove the brain with spatula, and place the brain on a sterile gauze pad. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3a8rv","text":"Split the brain in half down the midline to separate each hemisphere from one another. Place each hemisphere with the inside facing up to examine the hippocampus on the sterile gauze pad.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1fosp","text":"Gently remove darker hippocampal crescents with forceps (dissecting microscope can be used here to assist in locating the different brain regions).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7ps6j","text":"Remove remaining meninges with forceps (look for any veins and flip the brain section over a few times to use the sterile gauze pad to help remove the meninges).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"161tu","text":"Place sections in a sterile 50 mL conical polypropylene tube containing 10 mL complete S-MEM on ice labeled with the proper sex","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"abs1","text":"For pups at PND1/2, use between 8 and 15 pups and decapitate using sterile large scissors.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":50,"length":40}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fjviq","text":"Repeat steps, placing all cortical sections in a single 50 mL tube on ice per sex (all pups from the same litter with the same sex can be placed in the same 50 mL tube).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"49s8p","text":"Take a tail snip of approximately 0.5-1 cm (too much tissue may not be digested with the DNA extraction kit in the steps to follow) and place the tail in a 1.5 mL centrifuge tube, label the tube according to the sex of the pup, and then place it on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1lole","text":"Add 100 μL extraction solution from Extract-N-Amp Tissue PCR kit to each centrifuge tube containing a small tail snip for a pup (collected in step 10).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9ip9j","text":"Add 25 μL tissue preparation solution from Extract-N-Amp Tissue PCR kit","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"cu8t8","text":"Incubate at room temperature for 10 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"36md0","text":"Incubate in 95ºC hot water bath for 3 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1mkj1","text":"Remove from hot water bath and add 100 μL neutralization solution B from Extract-N-Amp Tissue PCR kit","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"e9unf","text":"Vortex","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"fmoc","text":"Store tissue extract at 4ºC or use for PCR immediately","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"494c6","text":"PCR amplification of Sry gene","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":21,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e651e","text":"Prepare master mix with the following per tissue extract:  10 μL extract-N-amp PCR reaction mix, 4 μL RNase- and DNase-free water, 1 μL of 25 μM forward primer (5’- TAC AGC CTG AGG ACA TAT TA -3’), 1 μL of 25 μL reverse primer (5’- GCA CTT TAA CCC TTC GAT GA -3'). An autosomal gene, Actb that encodes for beta-actin was used as control with the following set of primers:  Forward: 5’- AGC CAT GTA CGT AGC CAT CC -3’; Reverse: 5’- TGT GGT GGT GAA GCT GTA GC -3’.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":59,"length":5},{"style":"bold","offset":97,"length":4},{"style":"bold","offset":131,"length":5},{"style":"bold","offset":198,"length":4},{"style":"italic","offset":284,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3rvm7","text":"To PCR tubes labeled for each tail snip extract, add 16 μL of master mix ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8952n","text":"Remove tail snip and discard","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ectq","text":"Add 4 μL tissue extract to each designated PCR tube containing the master mix","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"akc44","text":"Run PCR program","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"skdv","text":"94ºC for 5 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8pa1r","text":"35 cycles of:  94ºC for 30 seconds, 50ºC for 30 seconds, and 72ºC for 1 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"bpoli","text":"72ºC for 7 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"c9n0j","text":"Prepare 1% agarose gel","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5cn8c","text":"Prepare 1x TAE buffer by diluting 10x TAE buffer with DI water (1:10).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"atvlm","text":"Add 1 g agarose to 100 mL 1x TAE buffer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e3pk4","text":"Microwave in 1 min intervals, swirling the flask each min until clear","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5eefk","text":"Let agarose cool to ~50ºC (warm to touch and able to grab)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"14hqs","text":"Add 2 μL EtBR or use another nucleic acid stain, such as GelRed per manufacturer's instructions such that final stain concentration is 1x.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8pbhs","text":"Pour gel into gel tray with well comb(s) in place","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1hs2e","text":"Let cool at room temperature for 1 hour (until solidified)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c884p","text":"Fill the gel electrophoresis box with 1xTAE buffer until the gel is fully covered","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7l5k6","text":"To each PCR-amplified DNA sample (20 μL), add 4 μL of loading dye (6x concentration).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8eo7l","text":"Carefully load 10 μL of the ladder followed by samples to each well","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"3tonl","text":"Run gel at 100 V for 1 hour","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"d8bmf","text":"Turn the power off and disconnect the electrodes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"45jn8","text":"Visualize under UV light to confirm sex of pups. The samples for males should show a band for Sry gene, amplified product of 317 bp while all samples should show a band for Actb gene, amplified product of 220 bp.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":94,"length":3},{"style":"italic","offset":173,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8pmep","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7fetr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e90u7","text":"Carefully remove as much complete S-MEM as possible with a sterile, cotton-plugged, 9' Pasteur pipet, taking care to retain all pooled brain sections.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cfbp2","text":"Add 7 mL prewarmed dissociation medium to a 50 mL sterile beaker with a stir bar and carefully pour sections into the beaker.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":9,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eoed8","text":"Gently triturate the sections 7-8 times using a Sigmacote-treated 10 mL serological pipet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5qona","text":"Stir for 10 min at low speed on a stir plate inside the biosafety cabinet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"52dbf","text":"While this is stirring, prepare 5 of the 15 mL centrifuge tubes for each extraction by adding 5 mL room temperature astrocyte growth medium to each tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"3hojm","text":"Additionally, thaw DNase I solution and place on ice","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"629mh","text":"After 10 min of gentle stirring, remove the beaker from the stir plate and place at ~45º angle for 3 min to allow the non-dissociated tissue to collect at the bottom of the beaker (e.g. using a 1.5 mL centrifuge tube holder).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"46m0b","text":"Carefully aspirate the dissociated cells in medium with a Sigmacote-treated 10 mL glass serological pipet (take care not to remove the undissociated tissue pieces).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"58sep","text":"Place this suspension into a 15 mL centrifuge tube that contains astrocyte growth medium","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cp0of","text":"Invert the 15 mL centrifuge tube 2-3 times to mix and then allow the tube to sit undisturbed during the continuing extractions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1ol9e","text":"Add 5 mL prewarmed dissociation medium to the 50 mL beaker containing undissociated tissue pieces.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5i8fj","text":"Add 100 μL of 8000 U/mL DNase I solution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cgmlo","text":"Stir for 10 min at low speed on a stir plate inside the biosafety cabinet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"emo0s","text":"After 10 min of gentle stirring, remove the beaker from the stir plate and place at ~45º angle for 3 min to allow the non-dissociated tissue to collect at the bottom of the beaker (using a 1.5 mL centrifuge tube holder works nicely here).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f15dm","text":"Carefully aspirate the dissociated cells in medium with a Sigmacote-treated 10 mL glass serological pipette (take care not to remove the undissociated tissue pieces).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fr0bd","text":"Place this suspension into a 15 mL centrifuge tube that contains astrocyte growth medium.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"95np0","text":"Invert the 15 mL centrifuge tube 2-3 times to mix and then allow the tube to sit undisturbed during the continuing extractions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fi436","text":"Add 5 mL prewarmed dissociation medium to the 50 mL beaker containing undissociated tissue pieces. Do not add any more DNase I solution for the remaining extractions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"69og","text":"Once you have dissociated a total of 3 times, remove undissociated tissue from the 15 mL tubes by inserting a sterile, fire-polished, cotton-plugged, Sigmacote-treated 9\" Pasteur pipette to the bottom of the tube and carefully aspirate the undissociated tissue. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3ojtu","text":"Place this tissue back into the 50 mL beaker and perform the final two extractions, adding another 5 mL prewarmed dissociation medium to the 50 mL beaker each time. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6qflm","text":"Pool dissociated cells and medium from all 15 mL centrifuge tubes into a singular 50 mL conical tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"asp2h","text":"Centrifuge for 10 min at 1000 rcf at 4ºC, in a swinging bucket rotor to pellet the suspended cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"f67v3","text":"Carefully aspirate medium from the cell pellet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bqqal","text":"Resuspend in 20 mL astrocyte growth medium by gently pipetting with a Sigmacote-treated 10 mL glass serological pipette.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":19,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b0q5n","text":"Allow cells to sit for 5 min and then discard any sedimented tissue from the bottom of the tube by using a fire-polished Sigmacoted 9\" Pasteur pipette.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cq2ov","text":"Gently mix 100 μL cell suspension with 100 μL of 0.08% trypan blue staining solution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1vpgp","text":"Allow cells to take up the trypan blue for 3 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6l2e3","text":"Determine the total cell number and cell viability with a hemacytometer and an inverted phase-contrast microscope (intact cells are able to exclude trypan blue while dead or damaged cells retain the dye).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2oe4u","text":"Plate 5+ T75 cell culture flasks with 7.5x106 cells per flask in 9 mL astrocyte growth medium.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":44,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"77tqm","text":"Place plated cells in a 37°C, 95% air/5% CO2, 95% relative humidity incubator.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1a72q","text":"After 18-24 hours, remove the old growth medium with a sterile 5\" Pasteur pipette attached to a vacuum source.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7vp0l","text":"Add 9 mL of fresh astrocyte growth medium to each flask.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"e2f6q","text":"Change medium twice per week (every 3-4 days) as described below.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d92de","text":"For primary astrocytes that are passage 0-2 (P0-P2), check cells under the microscope, shake flasks for 10 minutes at a medium-low speed on a plate shaker, check cells under the microscope again to make sure astrocytes are still adhering to the flask while the microglia have popped off, aspirate media, add 5 mL DPBS per T75 flask, rinse plate well by moving DPBS back and forth across flask bottom, aspirate, add 9 mL growth media per T75 flask, and then place back in the 37°C, 95% air/5% CO2, 95% relative humidity incubator.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"37fuq","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2g8ft","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"7AEF7000E92411ED80C675130310A3FE","height":340.00000000000006,"id":371558,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"e2qof","text":"Glial cells. All round cells are microglia that will \"pop\" off the flask with shaking.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mk5i47me.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mk5g47me.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/mk5h47me.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mk5f47me.webp","width":302.5889967637541}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"chpcm","text":"For primary astrocytes that are either confluent astrocytes, or are passage 3+ (P3+), check cells under the microscope, aspirate, add 9 mL growth media per T75 flask, check cells once again under the microscope, and then place back in the 37°C, 95% air/5% CO2, 95% relative humidity incubator.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ag2gi","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"92lfm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"6CE11C20E92411ED80C675130310A3FE","height":309,"id":371562,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4vl76","text":"Pure astrocyte culture.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mk5n47me.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mk5k47me.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/mk5m47me.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mk5j47me.webp","width":550}}}}

steps.section: Flow Cytometry to confirm purity of astrocytes

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"nncr","text":"Aspirate media from T75 flask","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Flow Cytometry to confirm purity of astrocytes
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6a0hn","text":"Rinse plate with 10 mL DPBS","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Flow Cytometry to confirm purity of astrocytes
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1vac0","text":"Aspirate DPBS","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"97fps","text":"Add 2 mL 37ºC 1x trypsin EDTA (0.25%)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Flow Cytometry to confirm purity of astrocytes
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5c9t2","text":"Incubate for 5 min in a 37°C, 95% air/5% CO2, 95% relative humidity incubator","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Flow Cytometry to confirm purity of astrocytes
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a9squ","text":"Tap sides of flask to allow cells to detach","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Flow Cytometry to confirm purity of astrocytes
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"43l0p","text":"Add 10 mL FACS media (DPBS + 2% heat-inactivated horse serum)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":10,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Flow Cytometry to confirm purity of astrocytes
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9i7t7","text":"Centrifuge at 4000 rcf at 4ºC, in a swinging bucket rotor for 10 minutes to pellet cells","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Flow Cytometry to confirm purity of astrocytes

steps.section: Flow Cytometry to confirm purity of astrocytes
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"b3jc3","text":"Resuspend in approximately 1 mL of fresh FACS media","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Flow Cytometry to confirm purity of astrocytes
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"epdp4","text":"Adjust cell number to a concentration of 1-5x106 cells/mL","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":47,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Flow Cytometry to confirm purity of astrocytes
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3u0i4","text":"Transfer 200 uL cell suspension to polystyrene round-bottom 12x75 mm falcon tubes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Flow Cytometry to confirm purity of astrocytes
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cc4r7","text":"Centrifuge at 4000 rcf at 4ºC, in a swinging bucket rotor for 10 minutes to pellet cells","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Flow Cytometry to confirm purity of astrocytes
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"64coq","text":"Add 200 uL/well paraformaldehyde (2%)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Flow Cytometry to confirm purity of astrocytes
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"f4og5","text":"Incubate at room temperature for 15 min on shaker","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Flow Cytometry to confirm purity of astrocytes
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7ffv0","text":"Centrifuge at 4000 rcf for 5 min at 4ºC","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Flow Cytometry to confirm purity of astrocytes
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5pm08","text":"Aspirate media using a fire-polished, cotton-plugged Pasteur pipette","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Flow Cytometry to confirm purity of astrocytes
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"26k7a","text":"Permeabilize (remove more cellular membrane lipids to allow large molecules like antibodies to get inside the cell easily) with 200 uL 0.05% Triton-X (in PBS)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Flow Cytometry to confirm purity of astrocytes
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"g7v","text":"Incubate at room temperature for 5 min on shaker","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Flow Cytometry to confirm purity of astrocytes
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9gt2r","text":"Centrifuge at 4000 rcf at 4ºC, in a swinging bucket rotor for 5 minutes to pellet cells","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Flow Cytometry to confirm purity of astrocytes
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8hpdk","text":"Aspirate media using a fire-polished, cotton-plugged Pasteur pipette","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Flow Cytometry to confirm purity of astrocytes
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8npit","text":"Blocking the non-specific binding of the staining antibody reagents","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Flow Cytometry to confirm purity of astrocytes
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5rdd7","text":"Prepare block solution:  1% donkey serum, 1% goat serum, 1x PBS; 490 μL PBS + 5 μL donkey serum + 5 μL goat serum","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Flow Cytometry to confirm purity of astrocytes
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4p2ht","text":"Add 100 μL blocking solution to each washed tube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"aoqrt","text":"Centrifuge at 4000 rcf at 4ºC, in a swinging bucket rotor for 5 minutes to pellet cells","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"904lp","text":"Aspirate blocking solution using fire-polished, cotton-plugged Pasteur pipet","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Flow Cytometry to confirm purity of astrocytes
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"df2cr","text":"Addition of primary antibody","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Flow Cytometry to confirm purity of astrocytes
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"63d23","text":"Add 0.1-10 μg/mL (100 uL) of each primary labeled antibody (we use primary antibody diluted 1:200 in blocking solution). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Flow Cytometry to confirm purity of astrocytes
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cbdp6","text":"Incubate primary antibody for at least 30 min at room temperature","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Flow Cytometry to confirm purity of astrocytes
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cs69i","text":"Centrifuge at 4000 rcf at 4ºC, in a swinging bucket rotor for 5 minutes to pellet cells","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Flow Cytometry to confirm purity of astrocytes
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"efee8","text":"Aspirate primary antibody solution using fire-polished, cotton-plugged Pasteur pipette","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Flow Cytometry to confirm purity of astrocytes
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9muap","text":"Addition of secondary antibody","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Flow Cytometry to confirm purity of astrocytes
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"18mpo","text":"Dilute secondary antibodies in blocking solution according to dilution according to dilution factor listed in materials.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Flow Cytometry to confirm purity of astrocytes
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9lj0u","text":"Resuspend cells in secondary antibodies (100 uL each)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Flow Cytometry to confirm purity of astrocytes
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"751ja","text":"Incubate for 1 hour at room temperature in the dark (cover with aluminum foil and turn lights off","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Flow Cytometry to confirm purity of astrocytes
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8uhp","text":"Wash 3x","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Flow Cytometry to confirm purity of astrocytes
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ftmm5","text":"Centrifuge at 4000 rcf at 4ºC, in a swinging bucket rotor for 5 minutes to pellet cells","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Flow Cytometry to confirm purity of astrocytes
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3h27r","text":"Aspirate antibodies using fire polished, cotton-plugged Pasteur pipette","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Flow Cytometry to confirm purity of astrocytes
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"doq7i","text":"Resuspend in 200 μL of ice-cold FACS media","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Flow Cytometry to confirm purity of astrocytes
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d676t","text":"Analyze on flow cytometer as soon as possible. Flow cytometry data analysis will involve identifying a population of cells through subsequent steps called gating and subjecting that population to various parameters through subsequent gating steps.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Flow Cytometry to confirm purity of astrocytes
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8ev8h","text":"First, make forward scatter (FSC-A) and side scatter (SSC-A) density plots for the cell events using the BD Accuri C6 Software. The first gate will be applied to remove debris (dense accumulation of events on the bottom left corner). Thus, the gate will select all events measured by the flow cytometer except the debris, these events should all therefore be cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Flow Cytometry to confirm purity of astrocytes
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e6sn9","text":"In the subsequent density plot of FSC-A x Width, the single cells are gated and selected, removing any clumps of cells from analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Flow Cytometry to confirm purity of astrocytes
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"epc6o","text":"Followed by this, the selected cells are analyzed for each of the cell-specific markers. First, microglia-specific marker Iba-1 was assessed by selecting an appropriate channel on the flow cytometer that is suited for the goat anti-rabbit 488 antibody detection. The Iba-1 positive cells are expected to be seen in the top left quadrant of the FSC-A x Iba-1 density plot.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Flow Cytometry to confirm purity of astrocytes
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"erupn","text":"Similarly, in the FSC-A x GFAP plot, GFAP-positive cells (astrocytes) are expected in the top left quadrant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Flow Cytometry to confirm purity of astrocytes
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"b7si","text":"By combining the gates from steps 72.3 and 72.4, both cell populations can be viewed on the same plot. Gates are applied as shown to determine astrocyte purity.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a8pct","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ahcqr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"C175CA10E92411ED80C675130310A3FE","height":358,"id":371566,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mk5s47me.jpg","shadow":true,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mk5q47me.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/mk5r47me.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mk5p47me.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f98ka","text":"When solidified, remove the combs carefully without damaging the gel.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4ha81","text":"Orient the gel in the gel electrophoresis apparatus such that the combs are placed towards the cathode. The DNA will be run from cathode to anode.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
